analyzed: de ltar gshegs sras kyi sa rnams kyang //

analyzed: 'on kyang byams dang snying rje'i smon lam gyis //

original: de las phyogs tsam rim pa'i tshul bzhin du //
analyzed: de las phyogs tsam rim pa'i tshul bzhin du //

analyzed: bshad par bya ste sems kyi spyod yul min //

original: ye shes tshul gyis rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes tshul gyis rdzogs par bya'o //

original: de 'dra'i spyod yul phra zhing blta dka' ba //
analyzed: de 'dra'i spyod yul phra zhing blta dka' ba //

analyzed: rang rig yin phyir brjod par mi nus kyang //

original: 'on kyang bde bar gshegs pa'i mthus brjod kyis //
analyzed: 'on kyang bde bar gshegs pa'i mthus brjod kyis //

original: sems dang mthun par nan tan gyis te nyon //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems dang mthun par nan tan gyis te nyon // zhes gsungs so //

original: de ltar bstan pa'i dbang las de brjod du med par bstan na /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i dbang las de brjod du med par bstan na /
translated: Thus, if the inexpressibility of that is taught by the power of the teaching,

original: ci ste ri bong gi rva ltar shin tu med pas na brjod par mi nus sam /
analyzed: ci ste ri bong gi rva ltar shin tu med pas na brjod par mi nus sam /
translated: is it like the horn of a rabbit, utterly nonexistent, so that it cannot be expressed?

analyzed: 'on te yod du chug na yang brjod par mi nus /

analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ltar na ni de brjod du med pa yin yang rang rig pa ma yin te /
translated: In the first case, even though it is inexpressible, it is not self-knowing.

analyzed: med pa ni rig par gzhag par mi nus te nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It cannot be posited as knowing, like the sky flower and so on.

analyzed: des na thal bar 'gyur ba dang / bzlog na gnod pa med pa'i phyir de ni ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since the reductio is not established, and since there is no fault in the reverse proposition, it is not established.

original: phyogs gnyis ltar na yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis ltar na yang mi rigs te /

original: gang yang bzhin du brjod du mi nus pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang yang bzhin du brjod du mi nus pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that it is inexpressible in any way,

original: bum pa la sogs pa yang brjod du med par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / brjod du med pa'i yod pa'i tha snyad nyid gang gi tshe su las yid ches par 'gyur /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yang brjod du med par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / brjod du med pa'i yod pa'i tha snyad nyid gang gi tshe su las yid ches par 'gyur /
translated: because it would follow that such things as pots are also inexpressible, and when inexpressibility is a convention, who would believe it?

original: bla ma la sogs pas kyang de nges pa skyed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bla ma la sogs pas kyang de nges pa skyed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor can it be generated by a guru, and so on,

original: brjod par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir so so rang gis rig pa ni mi 'dod pa nyid do zhe na /üîΩci glags lta ba 'di ni don dam pa'i sgo nas sam /
analyzed: de'i phyir so so rang gis rig pa ni mi 'dod pa nyid do zhe na / ci glags lta ba 'di ni don dam pa'i sgo nas sam /
translated: Therefore, one should not assert reflexive awareness.

original: 'on te kun rdzob kyi sgo can nyid @11b nas 'jug par byad /
analyzed: 'on te kun rdzob kyi sgo can nyid @11b nas 'jug par byad /
translated: Is this investigation from the point of view of ultimate reality or from the point of view of conventional reality?

original: gal te de don dam par na ni ji skad du smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: gal te de don dam par na ni ji skad du smras pa bzhin te /
translated: If it is from the point of view of ultimate reality, then it is just as we have said.

original: rang rig pa phra rab tsam yang kho bo yang khas mi len te /
analyzed: rang rig pa phra rab tsam yang kho bo yang khas mi len te /
translated: We do not accept even the slightest particle of reflexive awareness.

original: de la rigs pa'i stobs bcom ste gnas pa'i mthu ga la zhig yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la rigs pa'i stobs bcom ste gnas pa'i mthu ga la zhig yod par 'gyur /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis mkhyen nas chos rnams ma gzigs phyir zhes kyang gsungs pas so //
translated: Because it is said that the Buddha, having understood, did not see any phenomena.

original: 'on te glags 'di kun rdzob kyi sgo nas so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te glags 'di kun rdzob kyi sgo nas so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that this is the case only in terms of the conventional,

original: de ni glags su mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni glags su mi rung ste /

original: dngos po kun rdzob pa dag las kha cig ni brtags pa tsam ste /
analyzed: dngos po kun rdzob pa dag las kha cig ni brtags pa tsam ste /
translated: Some conventional things are mere imputations,

original: bdag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: kha cig ni rdzas su yod la bstan du rung ba ste bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Some are substantially existent but are suitable to be shown, such as a pot.

analyzed: kha cig ni rdzas su yod kyang rang rig pa'i bgo bo byung ba tsam las bstan du med pa ste /
translated: Some are substantially existent but are not suitable to be shown except by the occurrence of reflexive awareness.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'o //

original: de'i phyir rang gis rig pa de ni yod kyang bstan par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gis rig pa de ni yod kyang bstan par mi nus pa'o //

original: gal te bstan par mi nus pa'i rang rig pa de'i dbang du byas na gzhan gyi rgyud yod par ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bstan par mi nus pa'i rang rig pa de'i dbang du byas na gzhan gyi rgyud yod par ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: If, on the other hand, one were to take into account the reflexive awareness that cannot be taught, the existence of other continua would not be possible.

original: de med na 'gro ba'i don bya bar mi 'jug pas theg pa chen po'i tha snyad dag med do zhen /
analyzed: de med na 'gro ba'i don bya bar mi 'jug pas theg pa chen po'i tha snyad dag med do zhen /

original: rang rig pa ni mngon sum gyis grub pas skur pa mi gdab cing /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni mngon sum gyis grub pas skur pa mi gdab cing /
translated: Reflexive awareness is established by direct perception, so it should not be denied.

original: rgyud gzhan yod pa ni rjes su dpag las kyong du chud par bya ba yin pas na tha snyad mi 'jug go //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan yod pa ni rjes su dpag las kyong du chud par bya ba yin pas na tha snyad mi 'jug go //
translated: And since the existence of other continua can be understood through inference, it is not the case that conventions are not applicable.

original: 'di'i don ni tshad ma'i gzhung rnam pa mi bdun gyis shes pas 'dir mi dpyad do //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni tshad ma'i gzhung rnam pa mi bdun gyis shes pas 'dir mi dpyad do //
translated: Since the meaning of this is understood through the sevenfold analysis of valid cognition, it will not be analyzed here.

original: gal te rang rig pa grub na de gzhan rig pa dang phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba'i ngo bo yin pas /
analyzed: gal te rang rig pa grub na de gzhan rig pa dang phan tshun spangs pas 'gal ba'i ngo bo yin pas /
translated: If reflexive awareness were established, it would be mutually exclusive with the awareness of other things, and so they would be of a contradictory nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams rang rig pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams rang rig pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen par mi 'gyur te /

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they would know other things.

original: de mkhyen pa na ni rang rig pa'i ye shes mi 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: de mkhyen pa na ni rang rig pa'i ye shes mi 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: If it is known, then the self-knowing gnosis is not established.

original: sa bcu pa'i bar du ni de gnyis ji skad smras pa'i 'gal ba yin pas na /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i bar du ni de gnyis ji skad smras pa'i 'gal ba yin pas na /
translated: Up to the tenth stage, those two are contradictory as they have been described.

original: de dag la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen par ma brtags shing ;
analyzed: de dag la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen par ma brtags shing ;
translated: Therefore, in order to understand that all-knowing is not examined in those,

analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi tha snyad ni sems can gdul ba'i dbang ma gtogs par thams cad du rtogs pa dang mthun pa kho na yin zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir nye bar brtags nas bshad de /
translated: and that the conventions of the yogis are in accord with realization in all cases except for the power to subdue sentient beings, it is explained after being examined.

analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnal 'byor ba'i rgyud las so so rang gis rig pa'i skad cig ma @12a * //
translated: If it were not so, then how would the moments of self-realization of the yogis

analyzed: rnams ji ltar gzhan yid ches par byad pa'i mtshan nyid dag yin zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i don yang 'di nyid du gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: be the characteristics that engender confidence in others? The meaning of that will be determined here.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni 'gal ba de dag bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la ni 'gal ba de dag bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: But on the buddha stage, those contradictions are not to be imagined,

original: de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pas na /
analyzed: de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pas na /
translated: because that stage is inconceivable.

original: grangs med pa la su zhig bgrang //
analyzed: grangs med pa la su zhig bgrang //
translated: Who can count the countless?

original: tshad med pa la su zhig 'jal //üîΩkhyod kyi yon tan grangs dang ni //
analyzed: tshad med pa la su zhig 'jal // khyod kyi yon tan grangs dang ni //
translated: Who can measure the immeasurable?üîΩYou have no pride

analyzed: mthu la spobs pa ma mchis so //
translated: in the number or power of your good qualities.

original: zhes bstod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bstod pa'o //
translated: This is praise.

original: ye shes kyis zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: ye shes kyis zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: By wisdom means by the nonconceptual wisdom of self-awareness.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa zhes byas ba 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa zhes byas ba 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: What is this called nonconceptuality?

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis mi rtog pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis mi rtog pa'o zhe na /
translated: If it is nonconceptuality by nature,

analyzed: de ltar na ka ba la sogs pa bems po rnams ye shes su 'gyur te /
translated: then pillars and so on would become wisdom,üîΩbecause they are nonconceptual by nature.

original: 'phags pa lha'i zhal sngon nas kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa lha'i zhal sngon nas kyang /
translated: ƒÄryadeva also explains:

original: gal te ye shes mi shes na //
analyzed: gal te ye shes mi shes na //
translated: If wisdom is not conscious,

analyzed: shing ni ye shes yin par thal // zhes bshad do //
translated: then a tree would be wisdom.

original: 'on te rtog pa dang dpyod pa las 'das pas der bzhag na ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa yang der 'gyur te de dag la rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te rtog pa dang dpyod pa las 'das pas der bzhag na ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa yang der 'gyur te de dag la rtog pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rkyen gyis yul mi 'dzin pas der bzhag na ni rgyal ba la sogs pa yang der 'gyur ro //

original: 'on te mi rtog pa'o snyam sems pas rtog pa gzhan ma skyes pas der bzhag na ni de nyid rtog par red pas mi rtog pa ga la yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mi rtog pa'o snyam sems pas rtog pa gzhan ma skyes pas der bzhag na ni de nyid rtog par red pas mi rtog pa ga la yin zhe na /
translated: If it is posited as the nonarising of other thoughts due to the thought i am nonconceptual, then how can that be nonconceptuality since it is itself a conception?üîΩThose are not being considered here.

original: de dag ni 'dir mi bsam gyi so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis yun ring por dngos po rnams la bltas pa las /
analyzed: de dag ni 'dir mi bsam gyi so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis yun ring por dngos po rnams la bltas pa las /

analyzed: dngos po'i cha shas phra rab tsam yang mi dmigs par nges par pags kyis brtan par 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: nam zhig na yul gang la yang rnam par mi rtog cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes kyi snang ba rab 'byam tshad med pa rang gis rig pa de skye ba ni rnam par mi rtogs pa'i ye shes te /
translated: At some point, when one is no longer conceptualizing any objects, and the infinite, immeasurable appearances of the pristine wisdom of natural luminosity are self-cognizant, that is nonconceptual pristine wisdom.

analyzed: tshul rol mthong ba rnams kyis cung zad kyang ma myangs pa na ji ltar na nges par byed nus te /

original: khyab dang dbang la sogs pa ma myong //
analyzed: khyab dang dbang la sogs pa ma myong //

original: dpag tu med par gnas pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: dpag tu med par gnas pa'i rgyu //

original: 'jig rten spyi bor gyur pas kyang //
analyzed: 'jig rten spyi bor gyur pas kyang //
translated: Even those who are the crown of the world

original: myong bar gyur ba ma @12b yin pa ;
analyzed: myong bar gyur ba ma @12b yin pa ;
translated: have not experienced

original: / yang dag bdud rtsi dag pa 'di //
analyzed: / yang dag bdud rtsi dag pa 'di //
translated: this pure, true nectar.

original: thugs rje dag pa'i rgyu can gyi //
analyzed: thugs rje dag pa'i rgyu can gyi //
translated: It is the cause of pure compassion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs par /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs par /
translated: Except for the TathƒÅgatas,

original: gzhan gyi longs spyod ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi longs spyod ma yin no //
translated: it is not the enjoyment of others.

original: zhes bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi ni rigs su myong ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyi ni rigs su myong ba nyid do //
translated: Those who follow the TathƒÅgatas experience it in the family.

original: ye shes 'di ni rgyu las dpags te nges par yod par yid ches par bya'i /
analyzed: ye shes 'di ni rgyu las dpags te nges par yod par yid ches par bya'i /
translated: This wisdom is to be ascertained as existing by inference from its cause.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ltar gsal por gzung bar ni nam yang mi nus pas na slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyang /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ltar gsal por gzung bar ni nam yang mi nus pas na slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyang /
translated: But it is never possible to apprehend it clearly, as one does an object such as a pot.üîΩTherefore, the master DignƒÅga says:

original: bsgom pa'i stobs grub nas kha cig la nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma mtha' dag spangs pa sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i blo rnam rnam par mi rtog pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba
analyzed: bsgom pa'i stobs grub nas kha cig la nor bu dang dngul la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma mtha' dag spangs pa sgyu ma lta bu'i bdag nyid du snang ba'i blo rnam rnam par mi rtog pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba
translated: When the power of meditation is perfected, for some the nonconceptual mind, which is the nature of illusion, free from all signs of error, appears like the cognition of a jewel or silver.

original: ci zhig ltar yang dag par skyes na rnal 'byor bus shes bya'i sgrib pa yang dag par spong ngo zhes 'chad pa yang don 'dir gtan la phab pa ste ;
analyzed: ci zhig ltar yang dag par skyes na rnal 'byor bus shes bya'i sgrib pa yang dag par spong ngo zhes 'chad pa yang don 'dir gtan la phab pa ste ;
translated: When it arises in any way at all, the obscurations to knowledge of the beginner yogi are completely eliminated.

original: ci zhig ltar zhes pa ni bstan par mi nus pa'i tshig nyid do //
analyzed: ci zhig ltar zhes pa ni bstan par mi nus pa'i tshig nyid do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin any way at all‚Äù is a word that cannot be taught.

original: gal te so sor rtog pa'i shes rab la goms pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te so sor rtog pa'i shes rab la goms pa'i rgyu las 'bras bu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'byung na /
translated: If the result, nonconceptual exalted wisdom, arose from the cause of being habituated to discerning wisdom,

original: rgyu ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: rgyu ni rnam par rtog pa nyid yin la /
translated: then the cause would be conceptual thought itself.

original: de'i 'bras bu de las bzlog pas rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gal bas na /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu de las bzlog pas rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gal bas na /
translated: Since the result is the opposite of that, cause and result would be contradictory.

original: ye shes de rgyu ma yin pa las byung bas gang las kyang de 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: ye shes de rgyu ma yin pa las byung bas gang las kyang de 'byung ba'am /
translated: Therefore, since that exalted wisdom would arise from a noncause, it would not arise from anything at all.

original: rgyu ded par ltar mi 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ded par ltar mi 'byung zhe na /
translated: Or, like a cow‚Äôs horns, it would not arise from a cause.

original: ji ltar na 'di rgyu ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di rgyu ma yin /
translated: How could it not be a cause?üîΩWhen one is discerning, one enters into nonconceptual imagination.

original: so sor rtog pa na yang spros pa med par mos pas zhugs la 'bras bu'i skabs na yang spros pa med pa nyid thob bo //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa na yang spros pa med par mos pas zhugs la 'bras bu'i skabs na yang spros pa med pa nyid thob bo //
translated: And at the time of the result, one attains nonconceptuality itself.

original: phyogs ma lus pas rgyu dang 'bras bu khyad par med na ni rgyu dang 'bras bur yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: phyogs ma lus pas rgyu dang 'bras bu khyad par med na ni rgyu dang 'bras bur yang ji ltar 'gyur /

original: rgyus kyang ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: rgyus kyang ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What would the cause do?

original: phyogs 'ga'i rjes su 'gro bas kyang rgyur 'dogs so //
analyzed: phyogs 'ga'i rjes su 'gro bas kyang rgyur 'dogs so //
translated: It is designated as a cause because it is concomitant with some part of the result.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa stug po bkod pa las kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa stug po bkod pa las kyang /
translated: Moreover, the Dense Array says:

original: rva las lan tshvar gyur pa dang // 'dam bu las kyang sgog par 'gyur //
analyzed: rva las lan tshvar gyur pa dang // 'dam bu las kyang sgog par 'gyur //

analyzed: gdams ngag la brten nas tshogs kyi lam phal pa sbyangs nas /
translated: Relying on the instructions, they train on the ordinary path of accumulation.

original: skabs bzhi pa las bstan pa'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bskyed de /
analyzed: skabs bzhi pa las bstan pa'i thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bskyed de /
translated: They generate the factors conducive to liberation taught in the fourth chapter.

original: skabs dang po nas ji ltar bstan pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / go cha dang / skabs bzhi pa dang / lnga pa las bstan pa'i sbyor ba'i lam sbyangs te /
analyzed: skabs dang po nas ji ltar bstan pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / go cha dang / skabs bzhi pa dang / lnga pa las bstan pa'i sbyor ba'i lam sbyangs te /
translated: They train in the factors conducive to penetration taught in the first chapter, the armor, the fourth chapter, and the path of preparation taught in the fifth chapter.

original: de dag gi rtags thob par byas nas /
analyzed: de dag gi rtags thob par byas nas /
translated: Having attained the signs of those,

original: yang de yan chad rigs la gnas shing 'jug pa dang / rang gi skabs nas bstan pa dang / skabs lnga pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa dag spangs nas /
analyzed: yang de yan chad rigs la gnas shing 'jug pa dang / rang gi skabs nas bstan pa dang / skabs lnga pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa dag spangs nas /
translated: Again, from the stage of abiding in the lineage up to this point, one abides in the lineage and enters the Great Vehicle, the teachings of one's stage are taught, and the conceptions of the path of seeing in the fifth chapter are abandoned.

original: yang rang gi skabs kyi bsgom pa'i lam dang / tshogs dang / skabs lnga pa las ji ltar bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams spangs te /
analyzed: yang rang gi skabs kyi bsgom pa'i lam dang / tshogs dang / skabs lnga pa las ji ltar bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams spangs te /
translated: Again, the conceptions taught in the fifth chapter are abandoned and the path of meditation of one's stage is cultivated.

original: lam de gnyis rang rang gi rnam pa dang / mtshan nyid dang / @16b rtags dang bcas par sbyangs nas /
analyzed: lam de gnyis rang rang gi rnam pa dang / mtshan nyid dang / @16b rtags dang bcas par sbyangs nas /
translated: Having trained in the aspects, characteristics and signs of those two paths,

original: yang skabs drug pa yongs su sbyangs te /
analyzed: yang skabs drug pa yongs su sbyangs te /
translated: one is completely purified in the sixth chapter.

original: de nas bsgom pa'i lam khyad par can skabs lnga pa las ji skad bstan pa gtsor gyur pa skabs bdun pas dngos po kho nar bstan pa rnam pa dang bcas shing nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa'i ngo bo can rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: de nas bsgom pa'i lam khyad par can skabs lnga pa las ji skad bstan pa gtsor gyur pa skabs bdun pas dngos po kho nar bstan pa rnam pa dang bcas shing nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa'i ngo bo can rdzogs par byed de /
translated: Then, the special path of meditation taught in the fifth chapter is perfected, having become the entity of the accomplishment of definite emergence, together with its aspects and signs, as taught in the seventh chapter.

original: lam de dag thabs cad la yang sems bskyed pa dang / rigs dang / gdams ngag dang / dmigs pa dang / ched du bya ba dang / yon tan dang / skyon dag ni thun mong du ci rigs par sbyar te /
analyzed: lam de dag thabs cad la yang sems bskyed pa dang / rigs dang / gdams ngag dang / dmigs pa dang / ched du bya ba dang / yon tan dang / skyon dag ni thun mong du ci rigs par sbyar te /
translated: In all of these paths, the generation of the Thought, the family, the instruction, the objective, the special point, the good qualities, and the faults are to be applied in common, as is appropriate.

original: 'di ni skabs brgyad las lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skabs brgyad las lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the summary of the chapter on the knowledge of paths, the eighth chapter.

original: da ni sngar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mngon par rtogs pa thams cad nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa ste zhes smos pa dang / skabs brgyad pa las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs phyogs gcig tu bsdu ba cig car bstan te /
analyzed: da ni sngar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mngon par rtogs pa thams cad nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa ste zhes smos pa dang / skabs brgyad pa las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs phyogs gcig tu bsdu ba cig car bstan te /
translated: Now, the above statement, ‚ÄúThe knowledge of all modes is the one that is intent on the demonstration of all realizations,‚Äù and the chapter on the knowledge of all modes in the eighth chapter are taught all at once in a single section.

original: re zhig rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa de ni rgyu lam ltos par 'thob pa med pas de'i rgyu bstan pa lam thams cad bsdus pa byang chub kyi sems bcu dgu rgyu'i ngo bor bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa de ni rgyu lam ltos par 'thob pa med pas de'i rgyu bstan pa lam thams cad bsdus pa byang chub kyi sems bcu dgu rgyu'i ngo bor bstan to //
translated: The knowledge of all modes is not obtained by way of a cause, a path, or a dependence. Therefore, the cause of that is taught: the nineteen kinds of Thought of Enlightenment, which are taught as the essence of the cause, and which include all paths.

original: de yang gdams ngag gis smin par bya ba byed pas gdams ngag bstan to /
analyzed: de yang gdams ngag gis smin par bya ba byed pas gdams ngag bstan to /
translated: Moreover, since the instructions bring about the ripening of beings, the instructions are taught.

original: de yang gdams ngag gis legs par zin pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yin pas de bstan to //
analyzed: de yang gdams ngag gis legs par zin pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yin pas de bstan to //
translated: Moreover, since those who are well-equipped with the instructions are those who are in the stages conducive to penetration, they are taught.

original: nges par 'gyed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rigs la gnas pa yin pas rigs kyi dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: nges par 'gyed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rigs la gnas pa yin pas rigs kyi dbye ba bstan to //
translated: Since those who are in the stages conducive to penetration are those who abide in the lineage, the divisions of the lineage are taught.

original: rigs la gnas pa rnams la ni dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa rnams la ni dmigs pa dang ched du bya ba bstan to //
translated: For those who abide in the lineage, the focal object and purpose are taught.

original: yang slar thabs gzhan gyis sbyor ba'i lam go cha'i sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang slar thabs gzhan gyis sbyor ba'i lam go cha'i sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the armor-like practice of the path of preparation is taught by other means.

original: yang sngar mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / khyad par gyi lam gyi ngo bor 'jug pa dang / tshogs dang nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa rnams bstan to //
analyzed: yang sngar mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / khyad par gyi lam gyi ngo bor 'jug pa dang / tshogs dang nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa rnams bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the practice of the accumulations and the practice of definite emergence are taught as the essence of the previously mentioned paths of seeing, meditation and the distinctive path.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni sems bskyed pa tha ma gsum dang / skabs brgyad pa ril gyis bstan cing /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni sems bskyed pa tha ma gsum dang / skabs brgyad pa ril gyis bstan cing /
translated: Its result is taught by the last three arousals of mind and the entire eighth chapter.

original: skabs drug pa ni 'bras bu 'thob par bya ba la rab tu 'dris par byed pas lam spyir sbyar te /
analyzed: skabs drug pa ni 'bras bu 'thob par bya ba la rab tu 'dris par byed pas lam spyir sbyar te /
translated: The sixth chapter is the path in general, since it is the thorough familiarization that causes the attainment of the result.

original: de ltar na kha cig ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ltar na kha cig ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Thus, some are the cause of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: kha cig ni skabs bdun pa nas bstan pa'i rnam pa dang @17a * //üîΩmtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kha cig ni skabs bdun pa nas bstan pa'i rnam pa dang @17a * // mtshan nyid do //
translated: Some are the aspects and characteristics taught in the seventh chapter.

original: kha cig ni ngo bo dang / dbye ba dang / phrin las so //
analyzed: kha cig ni ngo bo dang / dbye ba dang / phrin las so //
translated: Some are the essence, divisions, and activity.

original: kha cig ni 'bras bu gzhan pas khyad par du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'bras bu gzhan pas khyad par du bstan pa ste /
translated: Some are taught as the result that is distinguished from others.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs kho nar skabs thams cad 'dus pas na 'og nas 'chad pa las kyang /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs kho nar skabs thams cad 'dus pas na 'og nas 'chad pa las kyang /
translated: Therefore, since all the chapters are included in the chapter on the knowledge of all aspects alone, the text below explains:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid lam //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid lam //
translated: The path to the knowledge of all aspects

original: ston pas 'di las bshad pa gang /
analyzed: ston pas 'di las bshad pa gang /
translated: Is taught by the Teacher in this.

original: zhes lam gcig pu kho na 'bras bu dang bcas par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes lam gcig pu kho na 'bras bu dang bcas par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the single path is taught together with its result.

original: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs su skabs thams cad rab tu bsdus pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i skabs su skabs thams cad rab tu bsdus pa'i tshul lo //
translated: This is the way all the chapters are included in the chapter on the knowledge of all aspects.

original: da ni zhar la bstan pa ni ngo bor skabs kyi bsdu ba gzhan bstan te /
analyzed: da ni zhar la bstan pa ni ngo bor skabs kyi bsdu ba gzhan bstan te /
translated: Now, the supplementary teaching is the teaching of the other collections in the context of the essence.

original: re zhig skabs dang po gsum ni thos pa dang / bsam pa'i shes rab kyi skabs ma lus par skabs de dag tu drangs te byang bar bya ba ste dang po'o //
analyzed: re zhig skabs dang po gsum ni thos pa dang / bsam pa'i shes rab kyi skabs ma lus par skabs de dag tu drangs te byang bar bya ba ste dang po'o //
translated: The first three contexts are the contexts of the wisdoms of hearing and reflection. All of them are drawn into those contexts and are to be mastered. That is the first.

original: skabs bzhi par ni ji ltar 'dris pa'i skabs gsum du bsdus pa rnams bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis goms par bya ba ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: skabs bzhi par ni ji ltar 'dris pa'i skabs gsum du bsdus pa rnams bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis goms par bya ba ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: In the fourth context, those that are included in the three contexts that are already familiar are to be cultivated by the wisdom of meditation. That is the second.

original: skabs lnga pa ni bsgom pa cung zad grub pas bstan pa ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: skabs lnga pa ni bsgom pa cung zad grub pas bstan pa ste gsum pa'o //
translated: In the fifth context, the teachings are slightly accomplished through meditation. That is the third.

original: yang skabs drug pa ni shin tu ring du 'dris par byed pa ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: yang skabs drug pa ni shin tu ring du 'dris par byed pa ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: Also, the sixth context is the one that is very familiar. That is the fourth.

original: de bzhin du skabs bdun pa ni yun ring du 'dris pa'i dbang gis lhun gyis grub par skad cig gis sdud par mthar gyur pa ste lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skabs bdun pa ni yun ring du 'dris pa'i dbang gis lhun gyis grub par skad cig gis sdud par mthar gyur pa ste lnga pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the seventh context is the culmination of the instantaneous inclusion through the power of being very familiar for a long while. That is the fifth.

original: brgyad pa ni 'bras bu ste drug pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni 'bras bu ste drug pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the result. That is the sixth.

original: 'di ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chad par 'gyur ba las //
translated: This will be explained.

original: mtshan nyid de yi sbyor ba dang // de rab de yi go ri mas dang // de mtha' de yi rnam smin ni //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de yi sbyor ba dang // de rab de yi go ri mas dang // de mtha' de yi rnam smin ni //
translated: The characteristic, its application, its excellence, its basis, its culmination, and its full accomplishment.

original: don bsdus gzhan te rnam pa drug / ces bstan pa nyid drang pa'o //
analyzed: don bsdus gzhan te rnam pa drug / ces bstan pa nyid drang pa'o //
translated: These are the six topics in brief.

original: yang skabs dang po gsum ni cir shes par bya ba yul tsam ste /
analyzed: yang skabs dang po gsum ni cir shes par bya ba yul tsam ste /
translated: The first three topics are the mere objects of understanding.

original: thos pa dang bsam pa dag gis skabs mtha' dag der bsres pa'i tshul gyis 'dris par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa dag gis skabs mtha' dag der bsres pa'i tshul gyis 'dris par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should become familiar with the entire subject matter by the method of mixing it with those three through listening and reflection.

original: skabs lhag ma bzhi ni legs par bsgoms pas rnal 'byor du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: skabs lhag ma bzhi ni legs par bsgoms pas rnal 'byor du bya ba yin te /
translated: The remaining four topics are to be practiced by means of proper meditation.

original: de bzhin du skabs tha ma ni 'bras bu yin pas mdor bsdus pa'i dbang gi skabs gsum nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du skabs tha ma ni 'bras bu yin pas mdor bsdus pa'i dbang gi skabs gsum nyid do //
translated: In the same way, the final topic is the result. Thus, there are three topics in brief.üîΩTherefore,üîΩThe cause of the object is threefold,

original: de'i phyir / yul gyi rgyu ni gsum dag dang // sbyor ba bzhi yi bdag nyid dang // chos sku phrin las 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / yul gyi rgyu ni gsum dag dang // sbyor ba bzhi yi bdag nyid dang // chos sku phrin las 'bras bu ni //
translated: The essence of the four applications, the dharmakƒÅya, activity, and result.

original: mdor bsdus gzhan te rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: mdor bsdus gzhan te rnam pa gsum //

original: @17b zhes ston pa'i don nyid 'dir brjod pa'o //
analyzed: @17b zhes ston pa'i don nyid 'dir brjod pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this teaching is expressed here.

analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa gsum ni las dang po pa'i sa nas brtsams te /
translated: Similarly, the three beginning with the knowledge of all aspects arise in stages from the level of earnest aspiration,

original: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi bar du rim par skye ba 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang du byas la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi bar du rim par skye ba 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang du byas la /
translated: on the path of seeing and on the path of meditation, in mundane and supramundane contexts.

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa rnams ni /üîΩlam bden pa mthong ba nas yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs na sngar ji ltar mthong ba rnams la slar yar 'dris par byed pas na /
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa rnams ni / lam bden pa mthong ba nas yang bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs na sngar ji ltar mthong ba rnams la slar yar 'dris par byed pas na /
translated: The complete realization of all aspects and so forth

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te ;
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang du byas pa yin te ;
translated: are supramundane, because from the path of seeing onward, on the path of meditation, one familiarizes oneself again and again with what one has previously seen.

original: de'i phyir 'chad par byed pa las rnam pa dang / lam dang / gzhi thams cad rnam par bsgom pa'i dbye bas go rims bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa gsum la 'jig rten pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha rtogs pa sngon du 'gro bar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mthongüîΩba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam rtogs pa yin la /üîΩrnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa gsum la ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chad par byed pa las rnam pa dang / lam dang / gzhi thams cad rnam par bsgom pa'i dbye bas go rims bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa gsum la 'jig rten pa'i nges par 'byed pa'i cha rtogs pa sngon du 'gro bar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam rtogs pa yin la / rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa gsum la ni //
translated: The three realizations such as the complete realization of all aspects are respectively realized in the mundane path of preparation, the supramundane path of seeing and the path of meditation, since they are respectively the realizations of the aspects, the path and all bases.üîΩThe three realizations such as the complete realization of all aspects are respectively realized in the mundane path of preparation, the supramundane path of seeing and the path of meditation, since they are respectively the realizations of the aspects, the path and all bases.üîΩThe three realizations such as the complete realization of all aspects are respectively realized in the mundane path of preparation, the supramundane path of seeing and the path of meditation, since they are respectively the realizations of the aspects, the path and all bases.üîΩThe three realizations such as the complete realization of all aspects are respectively realized in the mundane path of preparation, the supramundane path of seeing and the path of meditation, since they are respectively the realizations of the aspects, the path and all bases.

original: bsgom pa gong nas gong du gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis rnam pa thams cad du khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus pa'i ye shes zag pa med pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rim gyis skye ba yin pas cig car skye ba dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgom pa gong nas gong du gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis rnam pa thams cad du khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus pa'i ye shes zag pa med pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rim gyis skye ba yin pas cig car skye ba dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: The three realizations such as the complete realization of all aspects are respectively realized in the mundane path of preparation, the supramundane path of seeing and the path of meditation, since they are respectively the realizations of the aspects, the path and all bases.üîΩThe three realizations such as the complete realization of all aspects are respectively realized in the mundane path of preparation, the supramundane path of seeing and the path of meditation, since they are respectively the realizations of the aspects, the path and all bases.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha la sogs pa'i bstan pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha la sogs pa'i bstan pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the factors conducive to penetration, etc.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is stated.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The factors conducive to penetration are also illustrated,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa yang nges par 'dris par slar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa yang nges par 'dris par slar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the applications of mindfulness, etc. are also conducive to penetration.üîΩTherefore, in the explanation,

analyzed: de bas na 'chad par byed pa las / nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i //
translated: it is stated:üîΩOn the path of seeing and the path of cultivation,

original: lam dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la //
analyzed: lam dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la //
translated: the factors of penetration,üîΩrepeated reflection,

original: yang dang yang du sems pa dang ; /'jal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam //
analyzed: yang dang yang du sems pa dang ; /'jal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam //
translated: evaluation, and ascertainment are cultivated.

original: zhes bstan pa yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa yang bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa yang bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the applications of mindfulness, etc. are also included in this.

original: de ltar bstan pas kyang skabs gsum ste /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pas kyang skabs gsum ste /
translated: This teaching also has three sections:

analyzed: slob pa'i skabs dang / bslab pa bstan par byed pa'i skabs dang / bstan par gyur pa @18a * //

analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu'i skabs dang / 'bras bu'i skabs so //
translated: Thus, there is the section on the cause and the section on the result.

original: de ltar nges par bya nus bzhin du 'phags pa byams pa'i zhal snga nas ci'i phyir skabs brgyad la sogs pa des par bstan ce na /
analyzed: de ltar nges par bya nus bzhin du 'phags pa byams pa'i zhal snga nas ci'i phyir skabs brgyad la sogs pa des par bstan ce na /
translated: If one can ascertain it in this way, why did Arya Maitreya teach it as eight sections and so on?

original: don 'di yang 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ltar na skabs kyi don phal cher 'dir bshad pa ni /
analyzed: don 'di yang 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro // de ltar na skabs kyi don phal cher 'dir bshad pa ni /
translated: This point will be explained below.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis don brgyad bsdus zhes bstan pa'i skabs 'dir cig car kho nar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis don brgyad bsdus zhes bstan pa'i skabs 'dir cig car kho nar bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, the explanation of the meaning of the sections for the most part here is taught all at once in this section that teaches that the eight topics are subsumed by the three omnisciences.

original: gzung ba la tshogs med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba la tshogs med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the collection of the apprehended is to be made nonexistent.

original: 'dir skabs ji snyed du bstan kyang 'jug par byed pa rnams kyis ni rgyu mtha' dag phyogs gcig tu shes par bya ba dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'ang shes bar bya ba gnyis kho nar nges te /
analyzed: 'dir skabs ji snyed du bstan kyang 'jug par byed pa rnams kyis ni rgyu mtha' dag phyogs gcig tu shes par bya ba dang / de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'ang shes bar bya ba gnyis kho nar nges te /

translated: Therefore, these expressions and objects of expression are the means of knowledge and the objects of knowledge, the cause and the result. Although they are not deliberately created, they are nevertheless connected by the power of their own dynamic energy, and so they are contained within each other.

original: des na 'brel pa ni thabs yin par yid ches par byed pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'brel pa ni thabs yin par yid ches par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, the connection is the means of establishing the trust in the cause and result of the means of knowledge and the objects of knowledge.üîΩWith regard to that, it is said:

original: de la ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid lam //
analyzed: de la ; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen nyid lam //
translated: The path to omniscienceüîΩIs taught in this tantra

original: ston pas 'di las bshad pa gang //
analyzed: ston pas 'di las bshad pa gang //

original: gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin te //
analyzed: gzhan gyis myong ba ma yin te //

original: zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ste /
translated: This is what is to be expressed.üîΩThe meaning of the sutras is to be placed in the mindüîΩBy the wise, it is said,

analyzed: chos spyod bcu yi bdag nyid kyi //üîΩmdo don dran pa la gzhag nas //üîΩblo dang ldan pas rtogs 'gyur zhes //

original: zhes bya ba rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba ni dgos pa'i dgos pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba ni dgos pa'i dgos pa ston pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúin another way‚Äù shows the purpose of the purpose.üîΩThe purpose of the composition is

original: bde blag tu ni rtogs 'gyur pa //üîΩrtsom pa yi ni dgos pa yin //
analyzed: bde blag tu ni rtogs 'gyur pa // rtsom pa yi ni dgos pa yin //
translated: that it is easily understood.

original: zhes bya ba ni dgos pa ste //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dgos pa ste //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe purpose‚Äù shows the purpose.

original: dgos pa'i sgra ni 'dir dgos pa dang de'i yang dgos pa gnyi ga la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i sgra ni 'dir dgos pa dang de'i yang dgos pa gnyi ga la blta bar bya'o //

original: 'brel pa ni gang du yang tshig gis mi ston to //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni gang du yang tshig gis mi ston to //
translated: The connection is not taught by any words.

original: da ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas tshigs su bcad pa'i don dgrol ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas tshigs su bcad pa'i don dgrol ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: rnam par bshad pa 'di las ni dang po brjod par bya ba ston to //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa 'di las ni dang po brjod par bya ba ston to //
translated: In this explanation, the first statement shows the subject matter.

original: de nas ni 'brel pa ston to //üîΩde nas ni dgos pa'i dgos pa ston to //
analyzed: de nas ni 'brel pa ston to // de nas ni dgos pa'i dgos pa ston to //
translated: Then, it shows the connection.üîΩThen, it shows the purpose of the purpose.

original: de nas ni dgos pa ston to //
analyzed: de nas ni dgos pa ston to //
translated: Then, it shows the purpose.

original: de la ngag dang po ni bdag gis sngar bshad zin te skabs dang po nyid do //
analyzed: de la ngag dang po ni bdag gis sngar bshad zin te skabs dang po nyid do //
translated: Regarding that, the first statement is what I explained earlier, which is the first section.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The Blessed One is

original: bdud bcom 'jigs med skal ba bzang po dang // srid par 'gro las 'das dang shes rab dang // 'khrul dang bral zhing yon tan dpag med snod //
analyzed: bdud bcom 'jigs med skal ba bzang po dang // srid par 'gro las 'das dang shes rab dang // 'khrul dang bral zhing yon tan dpag med snod //
translated: The Buddha has destroyed the demons, is fearless, has good fortune, has transcended the migrations of existence, has wisdom, is free from error, and is a vessel for immeasurable good qualities.

original: yon tan 'di dag rab rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: yon tan 'di dag rab rgyas bcom ldan 'das //

original: zhes ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: zhes ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis bcom ldan 'das so //

original: cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis te /
analyzed: cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis te /
translated: By the three kinds of miracles, means by the miracles of magical transformation, declaration, and instruction.

original: de yang dang po ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul bstan pas pha rol zil gyis gnon cing /üîΩde nas ni gdul bya'i sems kyi rgyu ba lung bstan pas de rab tu dad par byed la /üîΩde nas rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag sbyin pa rjes su @24a * //
analyzed: de yang dang po ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul bstan pas pha rol zil gyis gnon cing / de nas ni gdul bya'i sems kyi rgyu ba lung bstan pas de rab tu dad par byed la / de nas rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag sbyin pa rjes su @24a * //
translated: The first is the miracle of magical transformation, which overawes others by displaying miracles such as walking on water without sinking.üîΩThen, by the miracle of declaration, which is the prediction of the thoughts in the minds of those to be trained, he inspires their faith.

original: bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis don dngos su bstan par mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyis don dngos su bstan par mdzad pa ni /
translated: Then, by the miracle of instruction, which is the gift of appropriate advice, he actually teaches the truth.

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag la rjes su bstan par mdzad pa de nyid kyis zhes smos pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag la rjes su bstan par mdzad pa de nyid kyis zhes smos pa'o //

original: rgyal ba'i yum rnam pa gsum char las brjod par bya ba nyid du bstan pa gang yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'dir tshig le'ur byas pa ni brgyud de brjod par bya ba'am /

original: don gyis brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: don gyis brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: The subject matter of the verses is taught by implication.

original: mdo rnams kyi ni dngos kyis brjod par bya ste sgra'i brjod bya yin no //
analyzed: mdo rnams kyi ni dngos kyis brjod par bya ste sgra'i brjod bya yin no //

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i brjod par bya ba dngos te sbra'i brjod par bya ba ni rgyal ba'i yum gyi gzhung nyid yin te /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i brjod par bya ba dngos te sbra'i brjod par bya ba ni rgyal ba'i yum gyi gzhung nyid yin te /
translated: The subject matter of the verses is the explicit subject matter of the Mother of the Victors, the content of the words.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: tshig le'ur byas pas ni rgyal ba'i yum gyi gzhung shes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pas ni rgyal ba'i yum gyi gzhung shes par 'gyur la /

original: gzhung de dag shes pa las ni don sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa shes par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhung de dag shes pa las ni don sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam 'bras bu dang bcas pa shes par 'gyur bas so //

original: de'i phyir 'dir gtsor ni don gyi brjod bya bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir gtsor ni don gyi brjod bya bstan te /

original: sgra'i brjod bya ni go sla bas so //
analyzed: sgra'i brjod bya ni go sla bas so //

original: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba dag thabs dang thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i tshul gyis 'brel bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa kho nar zad do //
analyzed: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba dag thabs dang thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i tshul gyis 'brel bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa kho nar zad do //
translated: The expression and the expressed are connected in the manner of means and that to be accomplished by means. This has already been taught above.

original: phyi rol pa dang cig shos kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa chos thams cad bdag med par goms par ma byas pa rnams kyis ma myangs pa de zhes bya ba ni don gyis brjod par bya ba de'i che ba bstan pa de /
analyzed: phyi rol pa dang cig shos kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa chos thams cad bdag med par goms par ma byas pa rnams kyis ma myangs pa de zhes bya ba ni don gyis brjod par bya ba de'i che ba bstan pa de /
translated: That which is not experienced by those outside and others who are not free from desire, etc., and who have not cultivated the selflessness of all phenomena, is called ‚Äúthat‚Äù which is the greatness of the meaning to be expressed.

original: sngar khyab pa dang dbang la sogs pa ma myong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung gis bstan pa nyid de go sla'o //
analyzed: sngar khyab pa dang dbang la sogs pa ma myong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung gis bstan pa nyid de go sla'o //
translated: That was previously taught by scripture, such as ‚Äúnot experiencing pervasion, power, etc.,‚Äù and so on. It is easy to understand.

original: da ni dgos pa'i dgos pa ston te /
analyzed: da ni dgos pa'i dgos pa ston te /
translated: Now the purpose of the purpose is taught.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa thams cad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa thams cad de /
translated: ‚ÄúBodhisattva‚Äù refers to all those who have generated the mind of enlightenment.

original: khyad par du ni rigs la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa bcu gsum po rnams te /
analyzed: khyad par du ni rigs la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa bcu gsum po rnams te /
translated: In particular, the thirteen irreversible stages are the stages of the bodhisattva, because they are based on the spiritual gene.

original: de dag ni nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are certain because they are irreversible.üîΩBy the sequence of the wisdoms born of hearing, etc.

original: thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa shes pa'i rim gyis zhes bya ba ni shes rab gsum gyi rim gyis 'jug pa'o ;
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa shes pa'i rim gyis zhes bya ba ni shes rab gsum gyi rim gyis 'jug pa'o ;
translated: means by the sequence of the three wisdoms.

original: / de lta na rgyal ba'i yum 'bad pa chung dus ngus cig car rtogs pa dgag pa'o //üîΩrang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bsgrub pa ci la yang ma rig par chas pa dag kho nas zhes pa ni /üîΩsngar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba smos pa'i don nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: / de lta na rgyal ba'i yum 'bad pa chung dus ngus cig car rtogs pa dgag pa'o // rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bsgrub pa ci la yang ma rig par chas pa dag kho nas zhes pa ni / sngar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba smos pa'i don nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the objection that the Mother Scripture is understood all at once with little effort is refuted.üîΩThe bodhisattvas, having attained the first stage, are endowed with the light of the Dharma, and they are able to enter into the meaning of the profound and sublime Dharma of the universal vehicle.üîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the verse shows that they do not enter by the power of another, i.e., by the power of a teacher.

original: nyams @24b su myong ba shin tu gsal ba zhes pa ni shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis yum gyi ming dang don sems la gsal por byas pa'o //
analyzed: nyams @24b su myong ba shin tu gsal ba zhes pa ni shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis yum gyi ming dang don sems la gsal por byas pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù shows that they enter by the power of their own wisdom, i.e., by the power of their own understanding.

original: de dag gis gzhag pa'i bag chags zhes pa ni yang dang yang goms pa'i dbang las sems de'i rnam par 'byung ba bstan pas lhun gyis grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag gis gzhag pa'i bag chags zhes pa ni yang dang yang goms pa'i dbang las sems de'i rnam par 'byung ba bstan pas lhun gyis grub pa yin gyi /
translated: The term ‚Äúhabit energy deposited by them‚Äù indicates that the occurrence of that mind is due to the power of repeated practice and is spontaneous.

original: til 'bru la sna ma'i me tog gi dris gos pa ltar ni mi bsam mo //
analyzed: til 'bru la sna ma'i me tog gi dris gos pa ltar ni mi bsam mo //
translated: It should not be thought that it is like the permeation of the fragrance of jasmine flowers on sesame seeds.

original: de ltar goms pa'i dbang de'i mthu las byung ba'i sems las byung bar gdags pa 'dris pa'i dngos po ma brjed pa de nyid dran pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar goms pa'i dbang de'i mthu las byung ba'i sems las byung bar gdags pa 'dris pa'i dngos po ma brjed pa de nyid dran pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that is called memory is the consciousness that is designated as a mental activity that occurs through the power of that habit energy. It is the nonforgetting of the thing that has been experienced.

original: 'dir dran pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa ni dran pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dran pa dang ldan pa'i shes pa ni dran pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Here, the consciousness that is associated with memory is the consciousness of memory.

original: de'i phyir thams cad du sems nyid gcig pu'i mthu'i bye brag las sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs kyi dbang gis bzhag pa ni slob dpon chos skyong gi zhal snga nas 'di dag gi de'i gnas skabs tsam la bzhag gi dngos su gal yod /üîΩces bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad du sems nyid gcig pu'i mthu'i bye brag las sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs kyi dbang gis bzhag pa ni slob dpon chos skyong gi zhal snga nas 'di dag gi de'i gnas skabs tsam la bzhag gi dngos su gal yod /üîΩces bshad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the master DharmÀù√¥dgatayaÀùh says, ‚ÄúAll are established by the power of the mind alone, by the power of the different states of mind and mental activities. They are established as mere states, not as real entities.‚Äù

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bsgrub par ci la yang rag ma las par chas pa shes rab rnam pa gsum gyi rim gyis nyams su myong bas gsal por byas pa'i bag chags kyi ngo bo dran pa'i shes pa
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par bsgrub par ci la yang rag ma las par chas pa shes rab rnam pa gsum gyi rim gyis nyams su myong bas gsal por byas pa'i bag chags kyi ngo bo dran pa'i shes pa
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, who is engaged in the perfect accomplishment of his own and others' goals, is independent of anything else. The essence of the habitual tendency of the clear realization of the experience of the three kinds of wisdom is the memory consciousness.

original: ring du yang ji ltar thos pa la sogs pa mi brjed pa'i ngang du gyur pa de la legs par bzhag nas zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: ring du yang ji ltar thos pa la sogs pa mi brjed pa'i ngang du gyur pa de la legs par bzhag nas zhes sbyar te /
translated: It is said that having well placed it in the state of not forgetting what one has heard and so on for a long time.

original: legs par bzhag pa ni 'dres pa'i dngos po rab tu ma brjod pas tshe rabs gzhan du yang rjes su 'brang bar gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par bzhag pa ni 'dres pa'i dngos po rab tu ma brjod pas tshe rabs gzhan du yang rjes su 'brang bar gsal ba'i phyir ro //

original: ci zhig dran pa'i shes pa la legs par bzhag nas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig dran pa'i shes pa la legs par bzhag nas she na /

original: chos spyod bcu yi bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: chos spyod bcu yi bdag nyid kyi //
translated: The meaning of the sutra, which is the nature of the ten Dharma activities.

original: mdo don zhes smos pa bstan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo'i don ma lus pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: mdo don zhes smos pa bstan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mdo'i don ma lus pa zhes smos te /

original: mdo don zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mdo don zhes pa dang sbyar ro //

original: mdo'i don de yang gleng gzhi la sogs pa'i gzhung ma lus pa'i don na ma /
analyzed: mdo'i don de yang gleng gzhi la sogs pa'i gzhung ma lus pa'i don na ma /

original: yang na snying po'i don tsam zhig dran pa'i shes pa la bzhag nas snyam pa la /
analyzed: yang na snying po'i don tsam zhig dran pa'i shes pa la bzhag nas snyam pa la /
translated: Or, having placed the mere meaning of the essence in the consciousness of mindfulness,

original: gnyi ga'i gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid ces pa smos te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i gtso bo ma yin pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid ces pa smos te /
translated: one should think, ‚ÄúIt is not the principal of both,‚Äù and thus one should say, ‚ÄúIt has the nature of the eight realizations.‚Äù

original: 'di ni don gtso bor gyur pas na dran pa'i shes pa la bzhag par bya ba ste snying po'i don yang de'i nang du 'dus @25a * //üîΩpa'i phyir ro //

original: gleng gzhi la sogs pa gzhung ma lus pa ni dran pa'i shes pa la nges par bzhag pa yang med de /
analyzed: gleng gzhi la sogs pa gzhung ma lus pa ni dran pa'i shes pa la nges par bzhag pa yang med de /

original: lung gi chos ni rtogs pa'i chos yid la byed pa na gzings dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung gi chos ni rtogs pa'i chos yid la byed pa na gzings dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Dharma of transmission is like a raft when one is practicing the Dharma of realization.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bos dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i ngo bos dman pa'i phyir ro //

original: mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid de'i rang bzhin bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid de'i rang bzhin bsdus pa ni /
translated: The essence of that which has the nature of the eight realizations is summarized as follows:

original: chos spyod bcu'i bdag nyid ces smos pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yin pas na de bstan pa ni byang chub kyi sems dang sbyin pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos spyod bcu'i bdag nyid ces smos pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yin pas na de bstan pa ni byang chub kyi sems dang sbyin pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa'i spyod pa zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: byang chub kyi sems smos pa ni las dang po pa'i sa nas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bos byang chub kyi sems dang nam yang mi 'bral ba byang chub na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dag la yang
translated: The mention of the thought of awakening is to show that from the stage of the beginner up to the stage of buddhahood, one is never separated from the thought of awakening by way of its nature as cause and effect. When one is awakened, one is endowed with the perfection of generosity and so on.

original: de dang ldan par bstan pa'i phyir smos te /
analyzed: de dang ldan par bstan pa'i phyir smos te /

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje'i snying po can gyi byang chub kyi sems des byin gyis ma brlabs par gyur na sbyin pa la sogs pa yang bsgrub pa'i spyod par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de gtso bor smos so //

translated: Since generosity and so on do not become practices to be accomplished without being blessed by the thought of awakening, which has the essence of emptiness and compassion, it is mentioned as the most important.
