analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba las bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúendowed with the thought of awakening,‚Äù omitting the middle word.üîΩ‚ÄúGenerosity and so forth‚Äù

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa zhes pa ni /
translated: are explained as follows:

original: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
translated: Generosity, ethics, patience, diligence,

original: bsam gtan shes rab pha rol phyir //
analyzed: bsam gtan shes rab pha rol phyir //
translated: meditative stabilization, and wisdomüîΩare the six perfections.

original: thabs stobs smon lam ye shes te //
analyzed: thabs stobs smon lam ye shes te //
translated: Skill in means, strength, aspiration, and gnosis

original: 'di dag pha rol phyin bcur 'dod //üîΩces bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di dag pha rol phyin bcur 'dod // ces bshad pa rnams so //
translated: are asserted to be the ten perfections.

original: de dag nyid bsgrub pa'i spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid bsgrub pa'i spyod pa ste /
translated: Those are the practices of accomplishment.

original: theg pa chen po la spyod pa gsum ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la spyod pa gsum ni /
translated: The three practices in the Great Vehicle are

original: dang po smon pa byang chub kyi sems ni 'jug pa'i spyod pa'o //üîΩde na 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni bsgrub pa'i spyod pa ste sngar ji ltar smon pa bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: dang po smon pa byang chub kyi sems ni 'jug pa'i spyod pa'o // de na 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni bsgrub pa'i spyod pa ste sngar ji ltar smon pa bsgrub pa'am /
translated: the initial aspiration thought of awakening, which is the practice of engagement;üîΩthe engaged thought of awakening, which is the practice of accomplishment;üîΩand the practice of perfection, which is the practice of completion.üîΩThe practice of engagement is the ten perfections.

original: 'bras bu legs par bsgrubs pas so //üîΩde nas sangs rgyas kyis ni grub pa'i spyod pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu legs par bsgrubs pas so // de nas sangs rgyas kyis ni grub pa'i spyod pa ste /
translated: The practice of accomplishment is the practice of the ten perfections.

original: chos kyi sku'i phrin las rnams so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i phrin las rnams so //
translated: The practice of perfection is the activities of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: kha cig ni 'dir chos spyod bcu'i bdag nyid ni 'phags pa byams pa nyid kyi zhal snga nas gzhan du /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'dir chos spyod bcu'i bdag nyid ni 'phags pa byams pa nyid kyi zhal snga nas gzhan du /
translated: Some say: The ten Dharma activities are the ten virtuous actions, since they are the nature of the ten Dharma activities.üîΩThey are writing, venerating, giving,üîΩlistening, reading, receiving,üîΩexplaining, reciting,

original: yi ge 'dri mchod sbyin pa dang // nyan dang klog dang len pa dang // 'chad dang kha ton byed pa dang // de sems pa dang bsgom pa'o //üîΩzhes gsungs @25b pa'o zhes 'chad pa ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: yi ge 'dri mchod sbyin pa dang // nyan dang klog dang len pa dang // 'chad dang kha ton byed pa dang // de sems pa dang bsgom pa'o // zhes gsungs @25b pa'o zhes 'chad pa ni mi 'thad de /
translated: contemplating and meditating.

original: de dag ni sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsgrub pa'i spyod pa tsam gtsor gyur pa'i phyir thams cad du mchog ma yin pa dang / slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyang 'grel par de dag gi zur tsam yang ma smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsgrub pa'i spyod pa tsam gtsor gyur pa'i phyir thams cad du mchog ma yin pa dang / slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyang 'grel par de dag gi zur tsam yang ma smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is untenable because they are not supreme in all respects, since they are merely the conduct established by the path of preparation and because master Jinaputra does not mention them in his commentary.

original: de bzhin du kha cig chos spyod bcu ni rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi las can dge ba bcu'o zhes 'dod pa yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig chos spyod bcu ni rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi las can dge ba bcu'o zhes 'dod pa yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Similarly, some assert that the ten Dharma activities are the ten virtuous actions, since they have the function of benefiting oneself and others.

original: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas 'dir de zur gyis kyang ma bstan pas so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas 'dir de zur gyis kyang ma bstan pas so //
translated: This is untenable because master Jinaputra does not mention them here, not even in passing.

original: de ltar grub pa'i spyod pa de spyad pa'i 'bras bu ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar grub pa'i spyod pa de spyad pa'i 'bras bu ci zhe na /
translated: What is the result of practicing that sort of perfected conduct?

original: chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rim pas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rim pas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The result of practicing that sort of perfected conduct is the realization of the stages of the grounds, such as the Joyous, which are characterized by the omnipresence of the basic field of phenomena.

original: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa ji snyed pa chos can du bsdu ba rnams te /
analyzed: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa ji snyed pa chos can du bsdu ba rnams te /
translated: The phenomena are all the phenomena included in the class of forms and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi dbyings ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbyings ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The basic field of those phenomena is their nature.

original: ji ltar me'i rang bzhin tsha ba nyid de la me'i khams zhes brjod pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar me'i rang bzhin tsha ba nyid de la me'i khams zhes brjod pa na /
translated: When the nature of fire is called the fire element,

original: me dang de'i khams tsha ba nyid ni cung zad kyang dbye bar yang mi nus la /
analyzed: me dang de'i khams tsha ba nyid ni cung zad kyang dbye bar yang mi nus la /
translated: the fire and its element, its heat, cannot be divided in the slightest.

original: thams cad nas thams cad du gcig par yang mi brjod de 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad nas thams cad du gcig par yang mi brjod de 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not said that they are the same in every way, because they are apprehended differently.

original: de bzhin du chos rnams dang de'i dbyings kyang de ltar blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos rnams dang de'i dbyings kyang de ltar blta'o //
translated: The phenomena and their basic field should be viewed in the same way.

original: don de nyid legs par mthong ba na chos thams cad mtha' yas pa ltar de'i dbyings kyang da dag las gzhan du mi dmigs pas na /
analyzed: don de nyid legs par mthong ba na chos thams cad mtha' yas pa ltar de'i dbyings kyang da dag las gzhan du mi dmigs pas na /
translated: When one sees that very object well, since the realm of that is not observed as other than those, the dharmadhatu is infinite like all phenomena.

original: kun tu 'gro bar rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ces smos so //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro bar rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ces smos so //
translated: Thus, it is called the characteristic of the conception of omnipresence.

original: mtshan nyid de'i mtshan gzhi gang la gdags she na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de'i mtshan gzhi gang la gdags she na /
translated: If it is asked what is the basis of characteristics that is designated,

original: sa rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: sa rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: it is called the ground Very Joyful.

original: sa dang po la de ltar rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: sa dang po la de ltar rtogs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, it is realized on the first ground.üîΩSince one possesses that characteristic, one is joyful because one sees the dharmadhatu in oneself in subsequent gnosis. Therefore, it is called that.

original: mtshan nyid de dang ldan pas na rjes kyi ye shes la bdag nyid chos kyi dbyings mthong ba'o zhes dga' ba skye bas na de'i ming de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dang ldan pas na rjes kyi ye shes la bdag nyid chos kyi dbyings mthong ba'o zhes dga' ba skye bas na de'i ming de skad ces bya ste /
translated: It is said:üîΩSeeing that enlightenment is near

original: byang chub la ni nye ba dang // sems can don grub mthong ba la //
analyzed: byang chub la ni nye ba dang // sems can don grub mthong ba la //
translated: and the benefit of sentient beings is accomplished,

original: rab tu dga' ba skye 'gyur te //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba skye 'gyur te //
translated: one becomes very joyful.

original: de'i phyi rab dga' zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyi rab dga' zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called Very Joyful.

original: zhes gsungs pa ni don gzhan gyi ming sbyar bar zad do //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa ni don gzhan gyi ming sbyar bar zad do //
translated: This is merely the application of the name of another meaning.

original: de ltar chos kyi dbyings rtogs na ci ste sangs rgyas nyid du ma gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi dbyings rtogs na ci ste sangs rgyas nyid du ma gyur zhe na /
translated: If one thus realizes the dharma-dhƒÅtu, why does one not become a buddha?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i las bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bya ba la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i las bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du bya ba la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the accumulation of merit, such as making offerings to the tathƒÅgatas for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges river, is not complete.

original: gzhan dag @26a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag @26a * //
translated: Others

original: ni de dag gi chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das par bzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: ni de dag gi chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa ni 'jig rten las 'das par bzhag pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: say that the realization of the dharma-dhƒÅtu by those is merely the reason for positing it as supramundane.

original: de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kho na'i thun mong ma yin pa'i gzigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kho na'i thun mong ma yin pa'i gzigs pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is the uncommon vision of only a perfect buddha that is just as it is.

original: de ltar byas na nga'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po shin tu phra zhing blta dka' la zab pa yang sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de lta bu ma mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: de ltar byas na nga'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po shin tu phra zhing blta dka' la zab pa yang sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de lta bu ma mthong bar gyur to //
translated: If that is so, then the tathƒÅgatagarbha that I teach is subtle, difficult to see, and profound, and it is not seen by bodhisattvas on the tenth stage.

original: zhes gsungs pa 'di yang legs par drangs par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa 'di yang legs par drangs par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: This is also well cited.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the second stage, the stainless, and so on.

original: de dag rtogs pa'i rims pas zhes bya ba ni sa de dag gi rim pa ni rang gis rtogs pa tsam gyis gzhag gi rnam pa gzhan du lha'i ris la sogs pa lta mtho dman dag med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de dag rtogs pa'i rims pas zhes bya ba ni sa de dag gi rim pa ni rang gis rtogs pa tsam gyis gzhag gi rnam pa gzhan du lha'i ris la sogs pa lta mtho dman dag med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The order of the stages is established by the order of their realization, because the stages are established by the order of their realization, and not by some other order, such as the order of the gods, etc., because there is no high or low among them.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dgos pa'i yang dgos pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba dgos pa'i yang dgos pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The direct realization of the knowledge of all the aspects is the ultimate purpose.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni skabs tha ma las ji skad du bstan pa dang rnam pa dang mtshan nyid dag las ji ltar bstan pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni skabs tha ma las ji skad du bstan pa dang rnam pa dang mtshan nyid dag las ji ltar bstan pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The knowledge of all the aspects is the nature of the knowledge of all the aspects as taught in the final chapter and as taught in the chapter on the aspects and characteristics.

original: de mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba ni skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa las ji skad du bstan pa'i skad cig ma bzhis so //
analyzed: de mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba ni skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa las ji skad du bstan pa'i skad cig ma bzhis so //
translated: The realization of that is by means of the instantaneous perfect enlightenment, as taught by the four instants.

original: des mngon sum du byas pa de nyid dgos pa'i dgos pa ste /
analyzed: des mngon sum du byas pa de nyid dgos pa'i dgos pa ste /
translated: The very realization of that is the purpose of the purpose.

original: 'bras bu mthar phyin cing phul du byung ba de las 'ga' yang mi rnyed pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: 'bras bu mthar phyin cing phul du byung ba de las 'ga' yang mi rnyed pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: It is the ultimate, the most excellent fruit, which is the nature of not being found anywhere else.

original: da ni dgos pa de grub pa'i rgyur gyur pas sngon du 'gro ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dgos pa de grub pa'i rgyur gyur pas sngon du 'gro ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the purpose of the metrical text, which is the preliminary cause for accomplishing that purpose,

original: gdul bya rnams kyis bde blag tu rtogs par 'gyur ba ni bstan bcos rtsom pa'i dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyis bde blag tu rtogs par 'gyur ba ni bstan bcos rtsom pa'i dgos pa yin no //
translated: it is the purpose of composing the treatise to make it easy for the disciples to understand.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar te man ngag bzung bde ba 'di /
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar te man ngag bzung bde ba 'di /
translated: This is what is to be applied. This easy method

original: las ni don rtogs par sla la /
analyzed: las ni don rtogs par sla la /
translated: is the easy understanding of the meaning.

original: de nyid kyis rgyal ba'i yum rnams kyi don bde blag tu 'dis rtogs par 'gyur bas na thabs sla ba'i dgos pa nyid yod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis rgyal ba'i yum rnams kyi don bde blag tu 'dis rtogs par 'gyur bas na thabs sla ba'i dgos pa nyid yod do //
translated: And by that very thing, the meaning of the Mother of the Victorious Ones is easily understood by this, so it has the purpose of the easy method.

original: rgyal ba'i yum gyi don gang zhen snyam pa la byang chub kyi sems dang sgrub pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i yum gyi don gang zhen snyam pa la byang chub kyi sems dang sgrub pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: What is the meaning of the Mother of the Victorious Ones? In response, it says the characteristics of the awakening mind and practice, and so on.

original: @26b byang chub kyi sems kyis ni spyod pa rnam pa gsum car bsdus la /
analyzed: @26b byang chub kyi sems kyis ni spyod pa rnam pa gsum car bsdus la /
translated: The awakening mind subsumes all three aspects of the bodhisattva's conduct.

original: sgrub pa ni sgrub pa'i spyod pa nyi tshe gzung ba ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni sgrub pa'i spyod pa nyi tshe gzung ba ste /
translated: Practice refers to the conduct of practice alone.

original: des na mtshan nyid 'di gnyis kyi ni mngon par rtogs pa'i snying po bsdus so //
analyzed: des na mtshan nyid 'di gnyis kyi ni mngon par rtogs pa'i snying po bsdus so //
translated: Thus, these two characteristics subsume the essence of the realization.

original: de dag nyid ni rtogs shing thob pa mngon par 'dod pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gang yin pa de bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag nyid ni rtogs shing thob pa mngon par 'dod pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gang yin pa de bstan pa yin la /
translated: The meaning of the perfection of wisdom, which is the realization and attainment of these very [characteristics], is what is taught.

original: de la yang ci'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa skyed ces rtog pa la ni /
analyzed: de la yang ci'i phyir mngon par 'dod pa skyed ces rtog pa la ni /
translated: In response to the question, Why does one give rise to the wish for that?

original: sngar ji skad du bshad pa'i dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'i ched du de rtogs pa dang thob par 'dod ces sbyar te 'di ni don gyi go rims ltar bshad pa'o /
analyzed: sngar ji skad du bshad pa'i dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'i ched du de rtogs pa dang thob par 'dod ces sbyar te 'di ni don gyi go rims ltar bshad pa'o /
translated: it is said, For the sake of the ultimate purpose, as previously explained, one wishes to realize and attain that. This is the explanation in accordance with the sequence of the meaning.

original: de ltar bstan pa ni sngar /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa ni sngar /
translated: The teaching on this is as follows.

original: dgos pa bsdus pa'i don bcas dang // zhes brjod pa las dgos pa la sogs pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dgos pa bsdus pa'i don bcas dang // zhes brjod pa las dgos pa la sogs pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The purpose, the concise meaning, and so on.

original: da ni bsdus pa'i don bstan pa dgrol bar bzhed nas /
analyzed: da ni bsdus pa'i don bstan pa dgrol bar bzhed nas /
translated: Now, intending to explain the concise meaning, he says:

original: de ltar 'brel pa la sogs pa bsnyad nas gdul bya rnams kyis bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar 'brel pa la sogs pa bsnyad nas gdul bya rnams kyis bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having thus explained the connection and so on, in order that disciples may easily understand, and so on.

original: mdor bsdus pa dang por bstan pas ni dkyus kyi sar bstan pa'i rta thogs pa med par rgyug par 'gyur ba ltar phyis don rgyas pa rnams mi 'khrugs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa dang por bstan pas ni dkyus kyi sar bstan pa'i rta thogs pa med par rgyug par 'gyur ba ltar phyis don rgyas pa rnams mi 'khrugs par 'gyur te /
translated: By first teaching the concise meaning, later the extensive meanings will be unconfused, like a horse running without restraint on a straight course.

original: de bas na bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: de bas na bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says in order that they may easily understand.

original: bstan bcos don rnam par phye ba byas pa yang ma 'dzings pa nyid kyis bshad par sla ba zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa po rnams kyis kyang dang po don khong du chud na /
analyzed: bstan bcos don rnam par phye ba byas pa yang ma 'dzings pa nyid kyis bshad par sla ba zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa po rnams kyis kyang dang po don khong du chud na /
translated: The treatise is also well-arranged, and because it is unconfused, it is easy to explain. This means that if the expounders first understand the meaning,

original: skyes bu rta'i kha lo ba yang dkyus kyis sngar mthong bas sems stobs che bar 'gyur zhing rta tshar gcod pa nus par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: skyes bu rta'i kha lo ba yang dkyus kyis sngar mthong bas sems stobs che bar 'gyur zhing rta tshar gcod pa nus par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: The charioteer of a horse, having seen the course previously, becomes of great courage and is able to control the horse.

original: gzigs nas zhes bya ba ni tshig gnyi ga'i mthar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzigs nas zhes bya ba ni tshig gnyi ga'i mthar sbyar ro //
translated: Having seen, is to be connected with both words.üîΩThe sutra, etc.

original: mdo dang zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa las /
analyzed: mdo dang zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa las /
translated: In the commentary, it is explained:

original: de la tshig le'ur byas pa dang po gnyis kyis ni dngos po brgyad bsdus pa'i phyir mdor bsdus pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshig le'ur byas pa dang po gnyis kyis ni dngos po brgyad bsdus pa'i phyir mdor bsdus pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: The first two verses are a summary because they include the eight topics.üîΩThe detailed explanation is taught in the commentary:

original: rgyas par zhes pa ni 'grel pa las tshig le'ur byas pa lhag ma bcu gsum gyis ni de dag nyid kyi don bsdus nas rgyas par bshad de zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rgyas par zhes pa ni 'grel pa las tshig le'ur byas pa lhag ma bcu gsum gyis ni de dag nyid kyi don bsdus nas rgyas par bshad de zhes bstan to //
translated: The remaining thirteen verses explain the meaning of those in detail.

original: lus rnam par gzhag pa ni spyir bstan pa rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: lus rnam par gzhag pa ni spyir bstan pa rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The arrangement of the body is the arrangement of the general teaching.

original: ji srid du phye ba rnams ni yan lag dang nyid lag dag lta bu yin pa'i phyir @27a * //
analyzed: ji srid du phye ba rnams ni yan lag dang nyid lag dag lta bu yin pa'i phyir @27a * //
translated: As long as the divisions are like the major and minor parts,

original: ro ; / legs pa bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni thabs bzang por sbyar ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ro ; / legs pa bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni thabs bzang por sbyar ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase it is well-spoken means that it is well-applied as a good method.

original: da ni bsdus pa'i don rgyas par rab tu shad na zlos bu'i nyes pas gos kyis dogs pas de mi dgrol ba'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bsdus pa'i don gyi tshig le'ur byas pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: da ni bsdus pa'i don rgyas par rab tu shad na zlos bu'i nyes pas gos kyis dogs pas de mi dgrol ba'i rgyu mtshan bstan par bsdus pa'i don gyi tshig le'ur byas pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, if the condensed meaning is explained extensively, fearing that it will be defiled by the fault of repetition, the reason for not unravelling it is stated: The verses of the condensed meaning, etc.

original: da ni bsdus pa'i don dang tshig gi don gyi bar skabs 'di nyid du brjod par bya ba rab tu mang po zhig yod pa de dag bdag gis brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bsdus pa'i don dang tshig gi don gyi bar skabs 'di nyid du brjod par bya ba rab tu mang po zhig yod pa de dag bdag gis brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, there are many things to be said in this very interval between the condensed meaning and the word meaning, which I will explain.
